content.description: Sit start with hands matched in the deep hueco with the mind-set that a scorpion, bat, or bird won't ravage your fingers. From there, make one big pull to an edge above, match on it, reach the lip, and mantel on top without hitting your head on the powerline.
content.protection: At least a pad or two. The landing has a big rock directly behind it.
content.location: It climbs the northeast face of Power Line.

content.description: Sit start with an awkward right hand sidepull-pinch and a left hand pocket-edge. From there, gain a left hand gaston, match on it, then gain the false lip, mantel up to the actual lip, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad or two. There is a great landing here.
content.location: It climbs the northeast face of Power Line.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the edge. From there, make a big pull up to a great right hand pocket, follow to the lip, and mantel on top avoiding the old powerline.
content.protection: A pad or two. The immediate landing is good but is surrounded by rocks.
content.location: It climbs the northeast face of Power Line.

content.description: Start with a left hand crimp/pinch and a right hand crimp about head height. Move to a nice, crimp sidepull then to a sloper jug at the lip. Traverse the lip to the right to an incut jug/sidepull, match your hands, and top out. This is fun climbing on good rock. The landing can be dangerous if there is an uncontrolled fall. Otherwise, the rocks under the problem and well-placed crash pads allow you step off the problem at just about at any time. I felt the crux is the topout, and a fall could be dangerous. Please have a good spotter.
content.location: This problem start on the left side of the southwest face.
